Mission.Author: KingRaptor
Mission.Description: Learn the unit roles of Zero-K in a field encounter scenario.
Mission.Name: Tutorial - A Day Out

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message
TriggerLogic.Message: Welcome, commander. Hostiles have entrenched themselves in this valley; we need to build up our forces and drive them out.

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message
TriggerLogic.Message:
Uh oh. We may have trouble - enemy raiders incoming.
We're airdropping riot units in to deal with the problem - stand by.

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message: Riot units excel in close-quarter combat, capable of chewing up swarms of raiders with ease. Their low speed and armor makes them unsuitable against skirmishers or fixed defenses.

TriggerLogic.Name: Add Objective
TriggerLogic.Description: A group of Bandit raider bots is attacking our outpost. Destroy them with your Warrior riot bots.
TriggerLogic.Title: Destroy Raiders

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message
TriggerLogic.Message:
Excellent! Notice how the Warriors pulverized the swarming raiders. This is the specialty of riot units.
We're sending in additional reinforcements now.

Heads up! We have new problems.
A small detachment of Rogue skirmisher bots is deploying in the nearby pocket. They have the range and speed to pick off our Warriors at will.
Use the Glaive raider bots to run down the enemy. When they run, try to pin them against other friendly units... or perhaps that mountain wall over there...

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message:
Raiders, as their name suggest, have excellent mobility and are best used for harassment and attacking vulnerable targets such as skrimishers and economy structures. Most static defenses and all riot units will chew them up, however.
HINT: Use an \255\255\255\0\Attack Move\008 order to have the raider's unit AI automatically jink as needed to evade enemy fire.

TriggerLogic.Name: Add Objective
TriggerLogic.Description: A group of Rogue skirmisher bots is bearing down on our outpost from the crater ridge. Run them down with your Glaive raider bots.
TriggerLogic.Title: Destroy Skirmishers

TriggerLogic.Message:
Great, that's the last of those skirmishers.
You're cleared to build new units from the factory. Take control of nearby metal extractors and build more solar collectors.
After that, we need to advance through the valley in the center of the map.

TriggerLogic.Description: Enemy forces are likely lurking in the valley. Flush them out.
TriggerLogic.Title: Push Through Valley

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message:
Always try to control as many metal spots as you can; resources are the key to victory.
Build more energy as needed to support your production.
HINT: Set your factories to Repeat to keep them turning out units.

Interesting. Fusion reactors - a high-value target, and with all the defences on the wrong side...
There are a number of Outlaw riot bots obstructing the path. A head-on rush could be quite costly. Try using Rocko skirmisher bots to neutralize them from a distance.

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message:
Skirmishers harass enemies from a distance, using their range and mobility to avoid enemy fire. They are particularly effective against riot and other slow-moving units.
Fast units such as raiders can easily overrun them and cut their thin armor to ribbons.
HINT: Giving skirmishers an \255\255\255\0\Attack Move\008 order enables their unit AI to maintain distance from enemies as appropriate.

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message
TriggerLogic.Message: There are a number of Outlaw riot bots obstructing the path. A head-on rush could be quite costly. Try using Rocko skirmisher bots to neutralize them from a distance.

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message:
Skirmishers harass enemies from a distance, using their range and mobility to avoid enemy fire. They are particularly effective against riot and other slow-moving units.
Fast units such as raiders can easily overrun them and cut their thin armor to ribbons.
HINT: Giving skirmishers an \255\255\255\0\Attack Move\008 order enables their unit AI to maintain distance from enemies as appropriate.

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message
TriggerLogic.Message:
Excellent! That'll teach them to put their energy source on the wrong side of their defences. Now advance and knock out the enemy base; that'll finish them off here.
Their Doomsday Machine overlooking the valley cannot fire its powerful main gun now that it's lost power, but their unpowered fixed defences could still give us trouble. Some Hammer light artillery bots might help with that.
By the way, did you know you can give your factory orders that the units it builds will then inherit? The most straightforward use of this is to set a rally point where units will gather after leaving the factory. You should set one close to the front line, so your forces will be close at hand when the action begins.

TriggerLogic.Name: Add Objective
TriggerLogic.Description: The enemy base is in the corner to the left side of the map. Level it and end this battle!
TriggerLogic.Title: Attack Enemy Base

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message: Artillery units excel at picking off static defenses (and the occasional static unit) from a safe distance. They are generally unable to hit moving units, and anything that gets in close will tear them to shreds in short order.

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message
TriggerLogic.Message:
Alright, we're closing in. They have some fixed defences up ahead that could give us trouble. Some Hammer light artillery bots might help with that.
By the way, did you know you can give your factory orders that the units it builds will then inherit? The most straightforward use of this is to set a rally point where units will gather after leaving the factory. You should set one close to the front line, so your forces will be close at hand when the action begins.

TriggerLogic.Name: Add Objective
TriggerLogic.Description: The enemy base is in the corner to the right side of the map. Level it and end this battle!
TriggerLogic.Title: Attack Enemy Base

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message: Artillery units excel at picking off static defenses (and the occasional static unit) from a safe distance. They are generally unable to hit moving units, and anything that gets in close will tear them to shreds in short order.

Uh oh. They have a Felon fire support bot defending the base. This unit drains its shield to fire devastating lightning bolts at enemies.
We could take it head on, but losses will be heavy. One trick is to use Zeus assault bots to draw its fire, attacking while its shield is depleted. We're dropping in a few of them now, and additional Zeuses can now be built from your factory.

Assault units like the Zeus are specialized in taking on enemy defenses. Though their DPS and often speed are generally mediocre, their high armor allows them to shrug off enemy fire.
Most assault units fare poorly against raiders and/or skirmishers.
Excellent work, Commander! The day is ours!
